true_false.question: Ammonites are one of the most important index fossils of Mesozoic strata.
In a geological map, the strikes of sedimentary rocks tell whether the rocks are folded.
"The present is the key to the past" applies 'Uniformitarianism'.
Graded bedding and cross-bedding can be used to determine whether the strata are upside down.
In the geological history, increase of organic carbon burial for a significantly long time (e.g., many thousands of years) would result in global cooling and increase of atmospheric oxygen.
Dr. Kent wants to know the precise age of a rock that contains the earliest animal fossils. The best method he can use is the K-Ar dating of zircons.
The age of the Earth is older than the oldest zircon ages obtained from the rock record in Australia and Canada.
The thickness of the continental crust is smaller than that of the oceanic crust.
Carbonate sediments are most common in transitional environments such as delta and estuaries.
The grain sizes of sandstones vary from 0.0625 to 2 mm.
Dating the handwriting in a book that was written in the 11th century commonly uses ¹⁴C dating.
The Era from 541 to 252 Ma in Earth history is called the Mesozoic Era.
A sandstone that contains 95% of quartz is compositionally more mature than a sandstone that contains 30% of feldspars.
A sandstone composed of grains from 0.4 mm to 0.5 mm is considered as better sorted than a sandstone with grains from 0.1 to 1.5 mm.
Diamictite and tillite are evidence of ancient glacial deposits. They are commonly grain-supported, well sorted and compositionally mature.

Igneous rocks that were formed by fast cooling of magmas in surface environments (e.g., rhyolite and basalt) commonly have larger mineral crystals than those formed by slow cooling magmas in subsurface (e.g., granite and gabbro).
The stratigraphic interval covering the total range of a species or other taxon is called a range zone.
The "ring of fires" refers to the volcanos and hot spots surrounding the Pacific Plate.
Fossil permineralization may include calcification, phosphatization, pyritization, and silicification.
Atomic mass number of an element refers to the sum of protons and neutrons of the atom.
The two most abundant silicate minerals of the Earth's crust are quartz and feldspar.
Primary (P) and Secondary (S) seismic waves can both penetrate the liquid outer core, but the surface waves cannot.

multiple_choice.question: Dinosaurs disappeared about 65 million years ago at the end of the Cretaceous Period. Evidence for the hypothesis that the extinction of dinosaurs was caused by meteorite impact include

choices.C: dinosaur fossils of the Jurassic strata
choices.D: Iridium anomaly from a thin clay layer of ~65 million years old
choices.E: abundant feldspar and quartz in 65-million-year-old rocks

multiple_choice.question: The age of the oldest zircon grains from a metamorphosed sandstone in Australia is about
When you read a geological map, which of the following information can tell you that the sedimentary rocks are folded?

choices.B: the color of the mapping units
choices.D: the Formation names of the geological units

multiple_choice.question: In a beach or barrier island shore, well-sorted quartz sandstone is commonly deposited. However, in an alluvial fan environment, matrix-supported conglomerates and sandstone are the major deposits. Based on this information, we can say that

choices.A: sediments of beach environments have higher maturity than those of alluvial fans
choices.B: sediments of beach environments have lower maturity than those of alluvial fans
choices.C: sediments of beach environments have maturity similar to those of alluvial fans

multiple_choice.question: Minerals tend to have larger crystals if they were derived from a slow cooling process. Dunite is an ultramafic rock formed at high temperature and high pressure in depth, while basalt is an extrusive rock formed by volcanic eruptions. From this information, you can infer that

choices.A: dunite may have gas bubbles as basalt has
choices.B: dunite should have smaller mineral crystals than basalt
choices.C: dunite should have the same mineral crystal sizes as basalt
choices.D: dunite should have larger mineral crystals than basalt
choices.E: dunite has no mineral crystals because of the high temperature

multiple_choice.question: Among the following metamorphic rocks derived from mudstones or shales, which one has the highest metamorphic grade?
Index fossils are important for geologists to tell the time of a specific stratigraphic unit. An index fossil should have

choices.A: slow rate of evolution and long span of existence
choices.B: cosmopolitan distribution, good preservation, and a relatively short span of existence.
choices.C: lived in shallow marine environments as benthic communities

multiple_choice.question: Animals first appeared in Earth history about 600 million years ago during the

Vertebrate forelimbs serve different functions (flippers for swimming, legs for running, hands, etc.), but all have similar bone construction. This similarity of structures in superficially dissimilar organisms is termed as
The study of all that has happened to organisms from the moment of death to final preservation as fossils is termed as
In continents, regions with exposure of crystalline basement of Precambrian age (> 2.5 billion years) that are stable and undeformed during the past 500 Ma are named as

In the Wilson cycles of plate tectonics, continental rifting, seafloor spreading, ocean-continental collision, and continental-continental collision represent the open and close of oceans. The Himalaya mountains represent the result of:
A sudden pulse toward high carbon isotope (δ¹³C) values recorded in the marine stratigraphic record can indicate an episode of
In the following items, which ones are evidence for continental drift?

choices.B: Animal and human migration from one continent to another during Holocene
choices.C: Geographic fit of continental contours, biogeographic similarity, geological similarities and the Pennsylvanian-Permian glacial movements across the southern continents
choices.D: The breakup of the supercontinent "Rodinia" at ~750 Ma and the formation of another supercontinent "Pangea" during the Permian Period.

multiple_choice.question: Before the theory of plate tectonics, the mountain building process was interpreted as resulting from contraction due to cooling of the Earth. This interpretation is incorrect because

choices.B: the Earth has been expanding since its formation
choices.C: the shortening of the earth's crust from cooling would be less than 1% but observations indicated more than 100% crust shortening in mountain belts
choices.D: chemical weathering prevented the Earth from cooling and contraction

multiple_choice.question: When we are interpreting the geological history of a certain area and exploring the potential reservoir layers for petroleum and water resources, we need to know the subsurface features in addition to the outcrops. One of the ways to obtain the subsurface information is to use
Magnetic stripes on the flanks of ocean ridges are evidence of

choices.C: lack of lateral movement of the oceanic crust
choices.D: continuous sedimentation on the sea floor

multiple_choice.question: From the ages and cross-cutting relationship in the diagram (right), the age of Unit B can be best estimated as

The earth's magnetic field can be recorded by sediment particles falling from the water column and by ferromagnetic minerals cooling down from hot magmas. The latter is called thermo-remnant magnetism. In the following rocks, which one is the rock type you can find the minerals of thermo-remnant magnetism:
The eastern African rift and Red Sea are examples of

In paleogeographic studies, fossils are commonly used to infer the ancient continental connections during specific time periods. Among the following, which one is the best candidate for paleogeographic reconstruction?
In the fossil record, paleontologists found that sudden changes of species occurred following or after long periods of little evolutionary progress. This evolutionary mode is called

We know that carbonates are precipitated from clear and warm marine environments. In the following environments, select the depositional environment where abundant carbonate deposits are most likely to be found.

In Walther's facies law, only geographically adjacent depositional environments can overlap their depositional facies together vertically. The following diagram shows the modern depositional environments. If the sea level falls for 100 m (gradually) and a few million years later, you drill a hole at location 1, what would be the most likely vertical facies sequence that you will see in the drill core from the bottom to the top?
The figure in the right marks a stratigraphic unit X in which fossils A, B, and C overlap. This stratigraphic interval is biostratigraphically called a (an)
The formal lithostratigraphic (rock) unit higher in rank than a Formation is a
Organic matter formed through photosynthesis would have much more light carbon (¹²C) content compared to the CO₂ that they used for photosynthesis. Therefore, their δ¹³C values are
As indicated in the figure (right), if we know the age ranges of fossil A (250-150 Ma), fossil B (195-110 Ma), and fossil C (160-95 Ma), the best age estimation for stratigraphic unit X would be

Professor Paul Kaufman measured a stratigraphic section of latest Paleocene age in France and collected the samples for isotope analyses. The results show an abrupt negative shift in δ¹³C. This negative δ¹³C excursion (see the figure on the right) could have resulted from

choices.A: increase of organic carbon burial during the late Paleocene
choices.B: a methane release event from catastrophic methane hydrate destabilization in response to global warming
choices.C: enhanced photosynthetic primary production due to increase of nutrient supply (e.g., phosphorous and nitrate).
choices.D: forest proliferation and burial of widespread coal beds

multiple_choice.question: Which of the following plate boundary types and modern examples are all correctly matched?

choices.A: Divergent boundary (E. Africa Rift, ocean ridges); convergent boundary (west and east Pacific Plate); transform boundary (San Andreas fault; transform faults at ocean ridges)
choices.B: Divergent boundary (eastern Pacific Plate); convergent boundary (Red Sea); transform boundary (San Andreas fault; transform faults at ocean ridges)
choices.C: Divergent boundary (eastern Africa Rift, Red Sea, ocean ridges); convergent boundary (central Atlantic ocean); transform boundary (trenches in eastern Pacific)
choices.D: Divergent boundary (southeastern Asia); convergent boundary (Himalaya Mountains); transform boundary (mantle plumes)
